chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Hintz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
* Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
* Comply with sexual offender counseling, treatment, and/or programs as recommended by the Psychological Evaluation.

* Comply with the CHIPS order already in effect.
* Complete all programming deemed appropriate by the assigned agent.
* Not to have contact with anyone under the age of 18 without agent and Dept of Social Service approval. Exception for his son is granted.
* Not to have unsupervised intentional contact with the victim without agent and Dept of Social Service permission.
* Register and comply with the sex offender registry.

timeConds.notes: * 6 months jail, with Huber, no credit. Report today to get start date. To be served within 60 days.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held on June 15, 2018

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Psychological/Psychosexual Evaluation dated 10-13-16 Dr. William Merrick

8:39 a.m. Defendant Robert J Hintz in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI. Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
Atty Wagner provides the Court with a Psychological Evaluation.
8:45 a.m. Court in recess to allow time for the Court to review the evaluation.

9:00 a.m. Court back in session.
BY THE COURT: The Psychological Evaluation is ordered sealed until further order of the Court.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.

BY THE COURT:**Probation**
Withheld Sentence
 36 months  Probation

Probation conditions:
* 6 months jail, with Huber, no credit. Report today to get start date. To be served within 60 days.
* Comply with the CHIPS order already in effect.
* Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
* Complete all programming deemed appropriate by the assigned agent.
* Not to have contact with anyone under the age of 18 without agent and Dept of Social Service approval. Exception for his son is granted.
* Not to have unsupervised intentional contact with the victim without agent and Dept of Social Service permission.
* Comply with sexual offender counseling, treatment, and/or programs as recommended by the Psychological Evaluation.
* Pay costs and surcharges during the term of his probation.
* Register and comply with the sex offender registry.


Appeal rights for is provided.
Court informs the Defendant, that as a felon, no firearms and not allowed to vote.
Defendant states he understands.
(emailed to counsel 6-8-18/kp)
Sentencing hearing on June 15, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert J Hintz in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. Ryan Wetzsteon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:04 a.m.  Case is called and appearances are stated.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State would ask that the case be adjourned to another date for a sentencing.
State would be asking for an Imposed/Stayed Prison Sentence, Place the Defendant on Probation for a Period of 3 Years with 6 Months of Conditional Jail - this will be subject to argument of the defense once the PSI is received
State has attempted to comply with victim notification, the State has been unable to locate the victim as her residence is unknown and all mail is returned to the DA's Office
State has spoken with the case manager at CPS and they have also had a difficult time locating the victim 
Victim is currently not placed with the mother but is in a kinship placement 
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Atty Wagner states that his client has undergone a psychosexual evaluation.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s) as stated in the Amended Information. 

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered 
PSI to be completed and provided to the parties at least one week prior to the sentencing
Atty Wagner will submit a sentencing memorandum but would like to have the PSI 2 weeks prior to the sentencing date for review prior to the submission of his memorandum
Parties to get a sentencing date from the Br 2 JA
Bond is to be continued
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 16, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on January 22, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Comstock Notice
Plea hearing on January 5, 2018 at 11:00 am.

9:42 a.m. Defendant Robert J Hintz in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information was filed this morning. Court reviews and notes there is no Comstock Notice. Matter rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 5, 2018 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Robert J Hintz in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

Arraignment:

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2015 at 10:30 am.
